page.title: 12TRANSPORT/TOURISM-BETHERSDEN
page.content: FOR RESIDENTS OF BETHERSDEN WHO OWN NEITHER CAR NOR CYCLE,PUBLIC TRANSPORT IS PROVIDED BY HOURLY BUSES,EASTWARDS TO ASHFORD AND CANTERBURY AND WEST TO EITHER HASTINGS OR TUNBRIDGE WELLS,VIA TENTERDEN.HOWEVER,SUNDAY SERVICES ARE ALMOST NON-EXISTENT,A MERE THREE BUSES EACH WAY.A CHAUFFEUR DRIVEN CAR AND SCHOOL TAXI SERVICE ARE PROVIDED BY OUR GARAGE.THOSE REQUIRING FAST TRAVEL TO DISTANT PARTS MUST TRAVEL THREE MILES TO AN ADJACENT VILLAGE TO CATCH A TRAIN.VILLAGERS WORKING LOCALLY MAINTAIN THEIR INDEPENDENCE BY CYCLING TO THEIR PLACE OF EMPLOYMENT. BETHERSDEN ATTRACTS VISITORS WHO ADMIRE THE CHURCH,RING PEALS ON THE SIX CHURCH BELLS OR WALK THE JEALOUSLY PRESERVED FOOTPATHS,SOME OF WHICH ARE MADE OF BETHERSDEN MARBLE.VISITORS ARE ACCOMMODATED AT A LOCAL MOTEL OR AT BED AND BREAKFAST ESTABLISHMENTS.
